bugs.title: sporadic disk "lockup" occurring when moving away from remmina window

bugzilla.short_desc: sporadic disk "lockup" occurring when moving away from remmina window

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

A few times a day I'll go to change workspace away from my remmina sessions by "swooping out" and instead of that happening, my Dell laptop disk light will go solid and the system locks up for 4-6sec before going OK again. This will not repeat itself immediately - the system will then act normally for hours before doing it again.

The only logs that appear related are a small number of these

Jul 23 09:02:54 mylaptop org.gnome.Shell.desktop: Window manager warning: 0x424bcc4 (remmina) appears to be one of the offending windows with a timestamp of 654685821.  Working around...
Jul 23 09:02:54 mylaptop org.gnome.Shell.desktop: Window manager warning: last_user_time (654685941) is greater than comparison timestamp (654685936).  This most likely represents a buggy client sending inaccurate timestamps in messages such as _NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW.  Trying to work around...

I use remmina to manage SSH and RDP sessions if that matters



Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):


How reproducible:

sporadic

Steps to Reproduce:
1.
2.
3.

Actual results:


Expected results:


Additional info:

I have tonnes of RAM - this isn't swapping related. The syslogs don't show evidence of any other kind of activity that could be I/O related, but there is always WIFI related logging going on when these occur (as before, not at a level to cause the light to go solid), so maybe it's some kind of feedback between networking and remmina?? Does remmina get/rely on network information via dbus/systemd/whatever? I use remmina to manage ssh and RDP sessions to systems that are continents away, and so I know for a fact remmina doesn't mind "high latency" network issues (ie which are OS level), but maybe it listens too much to chatter via the user-space network APIs? Just thinking out loud - no idea if that is true - just trying to help :-)

freerdp-2.0.0-31.20170724gitf8c9f43.fc26, remmina-1.2.0-0.39.20170724git0387ee0.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Hi there

I just upgraded to remmina-1.2.0-0.39.20170724git0387ee0.fc26 and instantly BROKE all my remmina profiles

Nothing worked - I couldn't SSH into anything. I think it lost access to ssh-agent (although I think that's actually gnome-agent these days?) as I use preshared keys for everything

I then "dnf downgrade remmina" and tried again and everything worked again.

So that's a really bad release

Jason

freerdp-2.0.0-31.20170724gitf8c9f43.fc25, remmina-1.2.0-0.39.20170724git0387ee0.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Nope - still broken

The issue is with preshared keys. If I create a new SSH profile, it prompts for standard Unix password correctly. But if I set to "public key (automatic)" (as all my existing profiles are set to do), I get an error popup of "null"

It's like the last two releases have lost their ability to interact with the gnome-keyring-daemon?

Downgrading to remmina-1.2.0-0.35.20170510git41c8de6.fc26.x86_64 (which also downgrades all the plugins as dependencies) fixes it.

Hello Jason.

Please test update https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-915a911681
remmina-1.2.0-0.44.rcgit.26.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-915a911681
remmina-1.2.0-0.44.rcgit.26.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2017-2834 freerdp: Out-of-bounds write in license_recv()

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-2834 freerdp: Out-of-bounds write in license_recv()

long_desc.thetext:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the authentication functionality of FreeRDP 2.0.0-beta1+android11. A specially crafted server response can cause an out-of-bounds write resulting in an exploitable condition. An attacker can compromise the server or use a man in the middle attack to trigger this vulnerability.

The vulnerability is located in the license server handling. The license message sent by the server contains a length field, which is not correctly verified by FreeRDP. For internal purposes, the library decreases this value by 4, if the server is sent a value inferior to 3, this will result in a negative value and the writing of packet contents outside of the allocated buffer in memory. This vulnerability can allow the execution of arbitrary code on the FreeRDP client side.

External References:

https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0336
http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2017/07/vulnerbility-spotlight-freerdp-multiple.html

bugs.title: CVE-2017-2835 freerdp: Out-of-bounds write in rdp_recv_tpkt_pdu

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-2835 freerdp: Out-of-bounds write in rdp_recv_tpkt_pdu

long_desc.thetext:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the RDP receive functionality of FreeRDP 2.0.0-beta1+android11. A specially crafted server response can cause an out-of-bounds write resulting in an exploitable condition. An attacker can compromise the server or use a man in the middle to trigger this vulnerability.

The vulnerability is located in the RDP received function of FreeRDP. Similar to the previous vulnerability, the RDP message sent from the server contains a length field, but this field is not verified by the FreeRDP client code. This length can become negative and allows the attacker to execute code on the client side.

External References:

https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0337
http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2017/07/vulnerbility-spotlight-freerdp-multiple.html

bugs.title: CVE-2017-2839 freerdp: Rdp Client License Read Challenge Packet Denial of Service

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-2839 freerdp: Rdp Client License Read Challenge Packet Denial of Service

long_desc.thetext:
An exploitable denial of service vulnerability exists within the handling of challenge packets in FreeRDP 2.0.0-beta1+android11. A specially crafted challenge packet can cause the program termination leading to a denial of service condition. An attacker can compromise the server or use man in the middle to trigger this vulnerability.

This vulnerability is located in the handling of security data function. The function reads a length value from the server packet. A malicious actor can send a specially crafted packet with a modified length value causing the client to crash and causing a denial of service condition.

External References:

https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0341
http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2017/07/vulnerbility-spotlight-freerdp-multiple.html

bugs.title: CVE-2017-2838 freerdp: Rdp Client License Read Product Info Denial of Service

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-2838 freerdp: Rdp Client License Read Product Info Denial of Service

long_desc.thetext:
An exploitable denial of service vulnerability exists within the handling of challenge packets in FreeRDP 2.0.0-beta1+android11. A specially crafted challenge packet can cause the program termination leading to a denial of service condition. An attacker can compromise the server or use man in the middle to trigger this vulnerability.

The vulnerability is located in the license read product info handling. A malicious crafted packet may cause the application to crash. The vulnerable code reads in an unsigned integer from the server message which then incremented by four as part of a length check. However, the size of the unsigned integer is never validated and thus the addition of four could cause an overflow and result in the client crashing.

External References:

https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0340
http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2017/07/vulnerbility-spotlight-freerdp-multiple.html

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-2837 freerdp: Rdp Client GCC Read Server Security Data Denial of Service

long_desc.thetext:
An exploitable denial of service vulnerability exists within the handling of security data in FreeRDP 2.0.0-beta1+android11. A specially crafted challenge packet can cause the program termination leading to a denial of service condition. An attacker can compromise the server or use man in the middle to trigger this vulnerability.

This vulnerability is located in the handling of security data function. The function reads a length value from the server packet. A malicious actor can send a specially crafted packet with a modified length value causing the client to crash and causing a denial of service condition.

External References:

http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2017/07/vulnerbility-spotlight-freerdp-multiple.html
https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0339

bugs.title: CVE-2017-2836 freerdp: Rdp Client Read Server Proprietary Certificate Denial of Service

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-2836 freerdp: Rdp Client Read Server Proprietary Certificate Denial of Service

long_desc.thetext:
An exploitable denial of service vulnerability exists within the reading of proprietary server certificates in FreeRDP 2.0.0-beta1+android11. A specially crafted challenge packet can cause the program termination leading to a denial of service condition. An attacker can compromise the server or use man in the middle to trigger this vulnerability.

The vulnerability is located in the parsing of proprietary certificates. In this function, the public key is parsed by the FreeRDP library. However the size of the key specified in the server message packet is inferior to 8, the FreeRDP library crashes.

External References:

http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2017/07/vulnerbility-spotlight-freerdp-multiple.html
https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2017-0338

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1475224,1475233,1475234,1475236,1475239,1475240

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
